definition[0]: if a piece of clothing fits you, it is the right size for your body
example[0]: His clothes did not fit him very well.
example[2]: The jacket’s fine, but the trousers don’t fit.
example[3]: I know this dress is going to fit you like a glove (=fit you very well).
definition[1]: to try a piece of clothing on someone to see if it is the right size for them, or to make sure a special piece of equipment is right for them
example[4]: I’m being fitted for a new suit tomorrow.
example[5]: He may need to be fitted with a hearing aid.
definition[2]: if something fits in a place, it is the right size or shape to go there
example[6]: I couldn’t find a key which fitted the lock.
example[7]: Most cookers are designed to fit level with your worktops.
example[8]: The plastic cover fits neatly over the frame.
definition[3]: to put something carefully into a place that is the right size or shape for it
example[9]: She fitted the last piece into the jigsaw puzzle.
definition[4]: if something fits into a place, there is enough space for it
example[10]: I wanted to put the wardrobe behind the door, but I don’t think it’ll fit.
example[11]: You might be able to fit some small flowering plants between the larger bushes.
example[12]: I don’t think we’ll be able to fit any more people into the car.
example[13]: We should be able to fit one more in.
definition[5]: to put a piece of equipment into a place, or a new part onto a machine, so that it is ready to be used
example[14]: I need to fit a lock on the door.
example[15]: Anti-theft devices are fitted to all our cars.
example[16]: The windows are all fitted with security locks.
definition[6]: if something fits another thing, it is similar to it or suitable for it
example[17]: The punishment should fit the crime.
example[18]: Police said the car fits the description of the stolen vehicle.
example[19]: Scientists often select facts to fit their theories.
example[20]: He didn’t fit the conventional image of a banker.
example[21]: The rhythm should fit with the meaning of a poem.
definition[7]: someone who is fit is strong and healthy, especially because they exercise regularly
example[22]: You must be very fit if you do so much running.
example[23]: He was young, good-looking, and physically fit.
example[24]: I swim twice a week to try and keep fit.
example[25]: She’s over eighty now, but still as fit as a fiddle (=very fit).
example[26]: I had just come back from holiday and was fighting fit.
example[27]: He may not be fit for Saturday’s match.
example[28]: I don’t know if I’ll be fit enough to take part in the race.
example[29]: Psychiatrists said he was fit to stand trial  (=he was mentally healthy enough).
definition[8]: suitable or good enough for something
example[30]: We made sure the land was fit for drilling.
example[31]: The food was not fit for human consumption.
example[32]: This book is not fit for publication!
example[33]: He is not fit to govern this country!
example[34]: This room is not fit to be seen!
definition[10]: a time when you feel an emotion very strongly and cannot control your behaviour
example[35]: She killed him in a fit of temper.
example[36]: He quit his job in a fit of drunken depression.
definition[11]: a short period of time when someone loses consciousness and cannot control their body because their brain is not working properly
example[37]: She used to have fits as a baby.
example[38]: people who suffer from epileptic fits
definition[12]: a short time during which you laugh or cough a lot in a way that you cannot control
example[39]: He had a violent coughing fit.
example[40]: We were all in fits of laughter trying to clear up the mess.
example[41]: Carl had us all in fits (=made us laugh a lot) with his stories.
example[42]: The girls collapsed into a fit of the giggles.
definition[13]: the way in which something fits on your body or fits into a space
example[43]: The dress was a perfect fit.
example[44]: I managed to get everything into the suitcase, but it was a tight fit.
definition[14]: if there is a fit between two things, they are similar to each other or are suitable for each other
example[45]: We must be sure that there’s a fit between the needs of the children and the education they receive.
definition[15]: to have a seizure (=a sudden condition in which someone cannot control the movements of their body)
definition[16]: to put a piece of equipment into place, or a new part on a machine
example[47]: Interactive entertainment systems have been fitted on all the airline’s 747s.
example[48]: Insurance is cheaper for homes fitted with alarms.
definition[17]: if there is a fit between a company’s different activities, they go well together and can be managed together profitably
example[49]: The fit between the two merged supermarket chains is excellent.
